meanings.definition: Nonmonetarists: Those who do not adhere to the principles of monetarism.
meanings.sent1: The nonmonetarists in the group proposed alternative economic theories.
meanings.sent2: Many nonmonetarists believe in different ways to manage the economy.
meanings.sent3: At the economics conference, the nonmonetarists joked about printing money as a solution.
meanings.sent4: The nonmonetarists stood out like colorful birds in a sea of black suits.
meanings.sent5: The nonmonetarists were like puzzle pieces that didn't fit the traditional economic model.

meanings.definition: Nonmonetarists: People who reject the ideas of monetarism.
meanings.sent1: She became one of the nonmonetarists after studying different economic theories.
meanings.sent2: The nonmonetarists gathered to discuss their views on monetary policies.
meanings.sent3: The nonmonetarists playfully debated the merits of printing money for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the world of economics, the nonmonetarists were rebels with a cause.
meanings.sent5: The nonmonetarists' voices echoed through the halls of the economic forum.
